alert.note: Alert for Brunswick (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 29 at 9:03PM EDT until April 30 at 2:48AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia... Meherrin River At Lawrenceville affecting Brunswick County. For the Chowan Basin...including Rawlings, Stony Creek, Sebrell, Lawrenceville, Emporia, Franklin...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Meherrin River At Lawrenceville. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Pasture land north of the river, downstream of the gage, begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9PM the river stage was 15 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:45 PM EDT Saturday was 15.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 4.2 feet early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.8 feet on 12/06/2005. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 300 AM EDT.
